summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Warden of MCC New York to the Medical Director in Washington, DC, dated November 5, 2019, responding to a multi-level mortality review. It includes attached procedures for monitoring, testing, and inspecting Automated External Defibrillators (AEDs) at the facility, along with an inspection checklist for November 2019. The document appears to be part of a post-mortem review of procedures following an inmate death.

persons.name: Jeffery D. Allen
persons.context: Recipient of the memorandum from the Warden regarding AED procedures and a multi-level mortality review.

persons.name: Warder
persons.context: Author of the memorandum to the Medical Director, transmitting comments and procedures related to AED inspections.

connections.description: The Warden is reporting to the Medical Director on procedures and recommendations following a mortality review.

events.title: Multi-Level Mortality Review
events.description: A review was conducted that made several recommendations concerning Automated External Defibrillators (AEDs) at MCC New York.

events.title: AED Monthly Inspection
events.description: Monthly inspection and testing of all AEDs at MCC New York was conducted, as documented on a checklist.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a response to a multi-level mortality review dated October 29, 2019, which made recommendations about AEDs at MCC New York.
It outlines detailed procedures for monthly and bi-annual inspection, testing, and maintenance of all Automated External Defibrillators at the facility.
An attached checklist shows AED locations and statuses (in service/out of service) at MCC New York for November 2019.
The document indicates institutional review and procedural changes following an inmate death, though the specific death is not detailed here.
